author: Jon Moody
title: Gianluigi Buffon says he may "do a Zidane" in his last-ever game - and HEADBUTT an opponent
text:
"This loaf is going right in your chest, son" (Photo: AFP/Getty) Share Get daily     
The date of 9 July 2006 possesses one of those "Where were you?" moments. 
You know, just like the JFK shooting or when Harold Bishop turned up out of nowhere on Neighbours once again. 
Because that was the day Berlin hosted the World Cup final - a dramatic encounter which, if you'll remember, saw Italy clinch the trophy on penalties over France. 
But that was very much secondary to the real talking point of that game - one of the most controversial/iconic moments in World Cup history. This: "Not my fault, you walked into my head..." (Photo: Getty) 
Yep, the remarkable headbutt from Zinedine Zidane - a man who hilariously claims has never lost his head - on Marco Materazzi , which was so famous even Family Guy did a sketch about it. 
And it turns out we may see something very similar once again on the pitch - courtesy of legendary keeper Gianluigi Buffon. (Photo: AFP) 
Despite claiming he was refusing to think of retirement ahead of his 1,000th game, he quickly changed his tune after Italy's pre-match press conference. 
Speaking to Sky Italia, the 39-year-old said: "How do I imagine my last ever game? Maybe I'll go out like Zidane, headbutting someone on the pitch!" 
That's one way to do it, sir. But don't expect to see him getting physical on the pitch any time soon. (Photo: Getty Images) 
"But before I think about how I'll end my career, we need to go to the World Cup in Russia in 2018," the stopper continued. 
"Maybe [my last game] could be at the World Cup. I still have some time to think about it though." 
Sounds to us like you already have - so we're off to put some money on it happening. Now, let's remind ourselves about it once again... Like us on Facebook
